body.p:
State of Kentucky Taylor County
To His Excellency
Gov Bramlette

Your Petitioner Mary Gill states that she is a poor widow woman with four children living with her & dependant upon her for a support, that her only son grown & on whom she relied for a support, by Judgent of Taylor Circuit at its March Term 1865 was sent to the state Prison or Penitenchry for three years. That he was sent to Frankfort at once & is now serving his time,

Your Petitioner beleves in her very hart that he is innocent of the Crime of Burglary for which he is convicted, she prays your honor to Pardon & release her said son from the said Judgement & Imprisonment, and for which she will every pray &c
Subsribed & sworn to before me by Mary Gill on this 19th day of October 1865 J. R. Robinson J. P. T. C.
We the Jury who tried the case of James L. Gill above named now believe he deserves Executive clemency, & pray the Governor to Pardon & release James L. Gill from the Penitenchry

attest
J. R. Robinson
JR
